alert.note: Alert for Arecibo; Barceloneta; Florida; Manati; Vega Alta; Vega Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 19 at 1:47AM ADT until September 19 at 10:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Arecibo County in Puerto Rico... Barceloneta County in Puerto Rico... Florida County in Puerto Rico... Manati County in Puerto Rico... Vega Alta County in Puerto Rico... Vega Baja County in Puerto Rico... * Until 900 AM AST Monday. * At 1247 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen since early Sunday morning. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 1 inch per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of mainstem rivers including Rio Tanama, Rio Grande de Arecibo, Rio Grande de Manati and Rio Cibuco as well as creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Rio Cibuco at Vega Baja has already reached major flood at 19.68 feet. Most of the mainstem rivers are beginning to subside, but still remain high. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Arecibo; Barceloneta; Florida; Manati; Vega Alta; Vega Baja
